com.google.ase.terminal
Class TranscriptScreen

java.lang.Object
  com.google.ase.terminal.TranscriptScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
Screen
public class TranscriptScreen
extends java.lang.Object
implements Screen

A TranscriptScreen is a screen that remembers data that's been scrolled. The old data is stored in a ring buffer to minimize the amount of copying that needs to be done. The transcript does its own drawing, to avoid having to expose its internal data structures.

          The number of active rows, includes both the transcript and the screen.

Field Detail

mColumns

private int mColumns
The width of the transcript, in characters. Fixed at initialization.

mTotalRows

private int mTotalRows
The total number of rows in the transcript and the screen. Fixed at initialization.

mActiveTranscriptRows

private int mActiveTranscriptRows
The number of rows in the active portion of the transcript. Doesn't include the screen.

mHead

private int mHead
Which row is currently the topmost line of the transcript. Used to implement a circular buffer.

mActiveRows

private int mActiveRows
The number of active rows, includes both the transcript and the screen.

mScreenRows

private int mScreenRows
The number of rows in the screen.

mData

private char[] mData
The data for both the screen and the transcript. The first mScreenRows * mLineWidth characters are the screen, the rest are the transcript. The low byte encodes the ASCII character, the high byte encodes the foreground and background colors, plus underline and bold.

mRowBuffer

private char[] mRowBuffer
The data's stored as color-encoded chars, but the drawing routines require chars, so we need a temporary buffer to hold a row's worth of characters.

mLineWrap

private boolean[] mLineWrap
Flags that keep track of whether the current line logically wraps to the next line. This is used when resizing the screen and when copying to the clipboard or an email attachment

Constructor Detail

TranscriptScreen

public TranscriptScreen(int columns,
                        int totalRows,
                        int screenRows,
                        int foreColor,
                        int backColor)
Create a transcript screen.

Parameters:
columns - the width of the screen in characters.
totalRows - the height of the entire text area, in rows of text.
screenRows - the height of just the screen, not including the transcript that holds lines that have scrolled off the top of the screen.
Method Detail

init

private void init(int columns,
                  int totalRows,
                  int screenRows,
                  int foreColor,
                  int backColor)

externalToInternalRow

private int externalToInternalRow(int row)
Convert a row value from the public external coordinate system to our internal private coordinate system. External coordinate system: -mActiveTranscriptRows to mScreenRows-1, with the screen being 0..mScreenRows-1 Internal coordinate system: 0..mScreenRows-1 rows of mData are the visible rows. mScreenRows..mActiveRows - 1 are the transcript, stored as a circular buffer.

Parameters:
row - a row in the external coordinate system.
Returns:
The row corresponding to the input argument in the private coordinate system.

Description copied from interface: Screen
Set line wrap flag for a given row. Affects how lines are logically wrapped when changing screen size or converting to a transcript.

                   int foreColor,

Scroll the screen down one line. To scroll the whole screen of a 24 line screen, the arguments would be (0, 24).

Specified by:
scroll in interface Screen
Parameters:
topMargin - First line that is scrolled.
bottomMargin - One line after the last line that is scrolled.

blockCopy

public void blockCopy(int sx,
                      int sy,
                      int w,
                      int h,
                      int dx,
                      int dy)
Block copy characters from one position in the screen to another. The two positions can overlap. All characters of the source and destination must be within the bounds of the screen, or else an InvalidParemeterException will be thrown.

Specified by:
blockCopy in interface Screen
Parameters:
sx - source X coordinate
sy - source Y coordinate
w - width
h - height
dx - destination X coordinate
dy - destination Y coordinate

blockSet

public void blockSet(int sx,
                     int sy,
                     int w,
                     int h,
                     int val,
                     int foreColor,
                     int backColor)
Block set characters. All characters must be within the bounds of the screen, or else and InvalidParemeterException will be thrown. Typically this is called with a "val" argument of 32 to clear a block of characters.

Specified by:
blockSet in interface Screen
Parameters:
sx - source X
sy - source Y
w - width
h - height
val - value to set.
foreColor - the foreground color
backColor - the background color

drawText

public final void drawText(int row,
                           Canvas canvas,
                           float x,
                           float y,
                           TextRenderer renderer,
                           int cx)
Draw a row of text. Out-of-bounds rows are blank, not errors.

Parameters:
row - The row of text to draw.
canvas - The canvas to draw to.
x - The x coordinate origin of the drawing
y - The y coordinate origin of the drawing
renderer - The renderer to use to draw the text
cx - the cursor X coordinate, -1 means don't draw it
